alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; Polk; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 1:33AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of York, northern Fillmore and southeastern Polk Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 133 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grafton, or 23 miles south of York, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Geneva around 140 AM CDT. Grafton around 145 AM CDT. Fairmont and Lushton around 150 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Exeter, McCool Junction and Waco. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 349 and 365. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for south central and east central Nebraska.
